meanings.definition: The act of filling or completing something.
meanings.sent1: The impletion of the puzzle brought a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent2: The impletion of the glass with water was satisfying.
meanings.sent3: The impletion of the cookie jar made the kids very happy.
meanings.sent4: The impletion of the room with laughter made it feel warm and cozy.
meanings.sent5: The impletion of the bucket with sand made it heavy to carry.

meanings.definition: The state of being full or complete.
meanings.sent1: The impletion of the basket with fruits made it colorful.
meanings.sent2: The impletion of the jar with coins made it heavy.
meanings.sent3: The impletion of the classroom with students made it lively.
meanings.sent4: The impletion of the sky with stars was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The impletion of the garden with flowers brought a sense of peace.
